document.heading: CitiStat Program – Establishment and Administration
An Ordinance Concerning CitiStat Program – Establishment and Administration

annotations.annotation: Ordinance 24-291 (effective July 22, 2024) designated this new Subtitle to be "Subtitle 59". That number, however, was already spoken for. Hence the placement here, with a different number.

para.text: In General.
In this subtitle, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
"Analysis" means the act of studying or examining something in detail.
"Analytics" means the systematic computational analysis of data or statistics.

"CitiStat meeting" means a monthly meeting between the CitiStat Program and a principal agency wherein the attending principal agency reports data and statistics that may be used to inform performance measures and policy initiatives.
"CitiStat process" means a system of applying insight gained from data analytics and analysis to management decisions within a principal agency.
"Continuous improvement processes" means an ongoing effort to better principal agency services and procedures.
Director.
"Director" means the Director of the Baltimore City CitiStat Program.
"Data-driven officer" means a person using data and analysis to drive performance in a principal agency.
Data-Driven Program.
"Data-Driven Program" means a comprehensive data analysis and performance management program for the City that includes:
performance management agreements;
the CitiStat process; and
an innovation lab.
"Data science" means the study of data with the intention of extrapolating knowledge or insights.
"Innovation lab" means a team of people focused on addressing issues identified through the CitiStat process.

"CitiStat meeting" means a monthly meeting between the Program and a principal agency wherein the attending principal agency reports relevant data and statistics that may be used to inform performance measures and policy initiatives.
"CitiStat memorandum" means a memorandum detailing the key issues relevant to a CitiStat meeting that includes:
data;
any follow-up responses from a previous CitiStat meeting.
"Performance" means the action or process of accomplishing a principal agency action, task, or function.
"Performance management" means the process of supporting or improving City agency performance through the use of tools including:
assessments;
employee counseling; and
continuous feedback.
"Performance management plan" means an agreement between a principal agency and the Program that establishes outcomes and performance expectations for the agency.
Principal agency.
"Principal agency" means any of the following City executive departments:
Fire Department;
Department of Finance;
Department of General Services;
Health Department;
Department of Housing and Community Development;
Police Department;
Department of Public Works;
Department of Recreation and Parks; and
Department of Transportation.
"Process evaluation" means an assessment of whether principal agency program activities have been implemented as intended and whether certain results were achieved.
"Program" means the Baltimor City CitiStat Program.
"Program management" means the oversight of a program's process and progress toward an established goal.
"Public policy" means a system of laws, regulatory measures, courses of action, and funding priorities related to a given topic that are promulgated by a governmental entity or its representatives.

section.heading: Program Established.
section.text: There is a Baltimore City CitiStat Program.

para.text: Director.
The Program shall be supervised and directed by a Director who shall report to the City Administrator.
Qualifications.
At the time of appointment, the Director shall:
have at least 5 years of experience in performance management; and
have experience in 1 of the following areas:
data science;
continuous improvement processes;
process evaluations;
program management; or
public policy.
Staff.
The Director may employ a staff, as provided for in the Ordinance of Estimates.
The Program shall:
review investigations into municipal processes and policies using data analytics, and analysis;
use findings of analytical reviews to make recommendations related to process improvement for City services;
in consultation with principal agencies establish and implement data-based process improvement systems for various City services;
in consultation with principal agencies and the City Administrator draft annual performance management plans that establish priorities, goals, and measurements to track and evaluate performance;
along with the Bureau of Budget and Management Research, establish measurements that can be considered within agency budget performance measures;

in consultation with the Chief Information Officer of Baltimore City Information Technology and relevant principal agencies assist in publishing accurate data on the City's Open Data Portal as allowed by applicable laws;
have the authority to request all relevant data; and
establish new CitiStat meetings
On or before January 31 of each year, the Program shall issue a report to the Mayor and City Council on:
the performance of each principal agency that participated in the CitiStat process over the previous year; and
identified areas for improvement and recommendations for each principal agency in the coming calendar year.
The Program shall:
develop an annual schedule to hold a CitiStat meeting at least once per month with each principal agency;
produce an agency memorandum 48 hours prior to a principal agency CitiStat meeting that contains all relevant data and other information for that meeting; and
produce a CitiStat memorandum within 2 days after a meeting that includes:
all requests and commitments made by the agency; and
any additional data or materials required by the next CitiStat meeting.
Each principal agency shall:
establish an internal CitiStat process to improve principal agency performance;
monitor progress on the agency's annual performance management plan;
develop plans to address gaps in municipal service delivery outcomes; and
report to the Program any relevant data requested by the Office.
Each principal agency shall identify a data-driven officer who shall report directly to the head of the agency and be responsible for managing that agency's CitiStat process.
